Sequence Information.Peptide Name: L-amino-acid oxidase (K-LAO; LAAO; LAO; reptilia, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family (FIG1 subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (highly active against L- Phe and L-Tyr, and moderately active against L-Trp, L-Met, L-Leu, and L-Arg), thus producing hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this enzyme. Exhibits diverse biological activities, such as hemorrhage, hemolysis, edema, apoptosis of vascular endothelial cells or tumor cell lines, antibacterial and antiparasitic activities (By similarity). This protein inhibits both agonist- and shear stress-induced platelet aggregation (SIPA). Effects of snake L-amino oxidases on platelets are controversial, since they either induce aggregation or inhibit agonist-induced aggregation. These different effects are probably due to different experimental conditions.

Literature.Title: Purification and properties of the L-amino acid oxidase from monocellate cobra (Naja naja kaouthia) venom.
Literature.Author: Tan NH, Swaminathan S.

Literature.Title: Inhibition of human platelet aggregation by L-amino acid oxidase purified from Naja naja kaouthia venom.
Literature.Author: Sakurai Y, Takatsuka H, Yoshioka A, Matsui T, Suzuki M, Titani K, Fujimura Y.

Literature.Title: L-Amino acid oxidase from Naja naja oxiana venom.
Literature.Author: Siigur J.,Vija H.,Ronnholm G.,Tonismagi K.,Samel M.
